entries.content:
## ✅ Subtask 2.2 Complete: WCAG 2.4.1 Verification

I've successfully verified that the skip-to-content link implementation fully complies with **WCAG 2.4.1 (Bypass Blocks)** best practices:

### Verified Requirements:

✅ **First Focusable Element**
- Skip link appears at line 578, immediately after `<body>` tag
- Positioned before all navigation and interactive elements

✅ **Visually Hidden Until Focused**
- Uses industry-standard technique: `position: absolute; left: -10000px`
- Width/height set to 1px with overflow hidden
- Remains accessible to screen readers

✅ **Properly Styled When Visible**
- High contrast: Teal background (`var(--color-teal-500)`) with white text
- Bold font weight for emphasis
- Generous padding, box shadow, and border radius
- `z-index: 9999` ensures visibility above all content
- Uses design system variables for consistency

✅ **Appropriate Focus Styling**
- Clear visual indicator maintained
- Positioned at top-left corner for easy discovery
- No outline removal that would harm accessibility

✅ **Target Element Configured**
- Main element has matching `id="main-content"`
- Includes `tabindex="-1"` for cross-browser programmatic focus support

### Status:
- ✅ Verification complete
- ✅ Documentation updated in build-progress.txt  
- ✅ Changes committed
- ✅ Subtask marked complete in implementation plan
- ✅ Ready for QA sign-off (all 5 subtasks complete)
I'll begin the QA validation process by loading all context. Let me read the necessary files to understand what was implemented.
